thread.title: James Packer's career milestones

author: news.com.au
title: James Packer's career milestones
text:
EDS: PLEASE NOTE LANGUAGE IN SIXTH PARAGRAPH
JAMES PACKER'S CAREER MILESTONES
The scion to the Packer family fortunes has shifted the focus of his father's business away from media to a growing casino empire. Early years - After completing his HSC at Cranbrook School in Sydney's eastern suburbs, spends a year as a jackaroo on the family's cattle station, Newcastle Waters, in the Northern Territory. Packer also works a stint in London at the NM Rothschild investment bank, and joins the advertising department of Consolidated Press after returning to Sydney. 1994 - Becomes a director of the Nine Network and chief executive of Australian Consolidated Press 1998 - Named executive chairman of his father's business Publishing and Broadcasting Limited (PBL), the owner of the Nine Network and Australian Consolidated Press. 2001 - Packer experiences his first big failure with the collapse of mobile phone company One.Tel, of which he was a director. He loses $327m of PBL's money in the investment and gets publicly lambasted by his father, who calls it a f*** up. 2003-2005 - Buys stakes in online classified businesses SEEK and Carsales.com, which are later sold at a significant profit. 2005 - Following his father's death, Packer inherits control of the family company PBL. 2007 - Splits PBL into two companies to focus more on the growing Crown casino empire. Becomes executive chairman of Crown while media operations are spun off to Consolidated Media. 2008 - Consolidated Media's stake in Nine drops below one per cent, ending the Packer family's 50 year association with the TV network. 2009 - Increases his stake in Crown to more than 40 per cent, while Crown loses $US250 million in a failed attempt to enter the Las Vegas market. 2012 - Packer sells Consolidated Media to News Corp, pocketing $1 billion to put towards Crown. 2013 - Sets up film production firm Ratpac-Dune Entertainment. 2014 - Steps down as CEO of the family's investment company Consolidated Press Holdings, and appoints Robert Rankin as his replacement. Also buys out Peter Holmes a Court's 37.5 per cent share in the South Sydney Rabbitohs NRL club to become partner with Russell Crowe. 2015 - Steps down as chairman of Crown Resorts to focus on overseas expansion for the casino chain in Las Vegas and Asia.
